intro: Senecio setchuenensis, commonly known as the Sichuan groundsel, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Sichuan, China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters, with hairy stems and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in forest margins or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
